definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: When he was not at the firm, Obama was teaching at the University of Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 他不在事務所的時候，就會去芝加哥大學講課。

sentences.english: In 1983, the Sociology Department at Chicago offered me a joint appointment.
sentences.chinese: 1983年，芝加哥大學社會學系給我一份邀請。

sentences.english: Quarterly. 1932- , American Society of Church History.
sentences.chinese: 美國宗教史協會，芝加哥大學。

sentences.english: After my third year of graduate study I became an Assistant Professor at Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 在研究生的第三年，我成爲了芝加哥大學的助教授。

sentences.english: The intellectual heart of this philosophy is here at the University of Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 這一哲學思想的核心是在此間召開的芝加哥大學。

sentences.english: He was a member of the University of Chicago championship basketball team in nineteen-oh-nine.
sentences.chinese: 他是1909年芝加哥大學冠軍賽籃球隊的隊員。

sentences.english: Researchers interviewed more than 8,000 hospitalized patients at the University of Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 研究人員在芝加哥大學調查了8000多位住院病人。

sentences.english: Mr. Wolfowitz has a doctorate in political science from the University of Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 沃爾福威茨先生擁有芝加哥大學政治學博士學位。

sentences.english: She is a postgraduate at the University of Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 她是芝加哥大學的一名研究生。

sentences.english: At the University of Chicago there aren't a lot of jobs for lexicographers.
sentences.chinese: 在芝加哥大學，詞典編纂者並沒有很多的工作。

sentences.english: The University of Chicago estimates that a year's study will cost $56, 640.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥大學一年的學習費用是56460美元。

pinyin: Pu3 lin2 si1 dun4 Da4 xue2
Ge1 lun2 bi3 ya4 Da4 xue2
Lun2 dun1 Da4 xue2 Xue2 yuan4

definition: Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China

pinyin: Guang3 zhou1 Mei3 shu4 Xue2 yuan4

definition: University of International Relations, Beijing, established in 1949
pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Guan1 xi4 Xue2 yuan4
